intro: Pimpinella media, commonly known as cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feather-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that resemble those of Queen Anne's lace. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions. Its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, and it is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and disturbed soils. Pimpinella media is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
